summary.span: 创建和控制线程，设置其优先级并获取其状态。

span.span: Creates and controls a thread, sets its priority, and gets its status.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程启动时，公共语言运行时将自动创建一个前台线程执行应用程序代码。When a process starts, the common language runtime automatically creates a single foreground thread to execute application code. 此主前台线程，以及一个进程可以创建一个或多个线程来执行与进程关联的程序代码的一部分。Along with this main foreground thread, a process can create one or more threads to execute a portion of the program code associated with the process. 在前台或在后台，可以执行这些线程。These threads can execute either in the foreground or in the background. 此外，你可以使用类在由公共语言运行时管理的工作线程上执行代码。In addition, you can use the class to execute code on worker threads that are managed by the common language runtime. 本节内容In this section [启动线程](#Starting) [Starting a thread](#Starting) [检索线程对象](#Retrieving) [Retrieving Thread objects](#Retrieving) [前台和后台线程](#Foreground) [Foreground and background threads](#Foreground) [区域性和线程](#Culture) [Culture and threads](#Culture) [获取相关信息和控制线程Getting information about and controlling threads](#Properties) ## 启动线程Starting a thread 通过提供一个委托，表示该线程是在其类构造函数中执行的方法启动线程。You start a thread by supplying a delegate that represents the method the thread is to execute in its class constructor. 然后，你调用方法，以开始执行。You then call the method to begin execution. 构造函数可以采用两个委托类型，具体取决于是否可以将自变量传递给要执行的方法之一：The constructors can take either of two delegate types, depending on whether you can pass an argument to the method to be executed: - 如果该方法不具有任何参数，则传递委托给构造函数。If the method has no arguments, you pass a delegate to the constructor. 它具有签名：It has the signature: ```csharp public delegate void ThreadStart() ``` ```vb Public Delegate Sub ThreadStart() ``` 下面的示例创建并开始执行的线程`ExecuteInForeground`方法。The following example creates and starts a thread that executes the `ExecuteInForeground` method. 方法显示某些线程属性，有关的信息，然后执行它暂停半秒钟和显示已用的秒数的循环。The method displays information about some thread properties, then executes a loop in which it pauses for half a second and displays the elapsed number of seconds. 当线程执行至少五秒内时，则循环结束，并且该线程将终止执行。When the thread has executed for at least five seconds, the loop ends and the thread terminates execution. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/cs/ThreadStart1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/vb/ThreadStart1.vb#1)] - 如果该方法具有一个自变量，则传递委托给构造函数。If the method has an argument, you pass a delegate to the constructor. 它具有签名：It has the signature: ```csharp public delegate void ParameterizedThreadStart(object obj) ``` ```vb Public Delegate Sub ParameterizedThreadStart(obj As Object) ``` 然后，执行委托的方法可以强制转换 （在 C# 中) 或者 （在 Visual Basic 中) 将参数转换为适当的类型。The method executed by the delegate can then cast (in C#) or convert (in Visual Basic) the parameter to the appropriate type. 下面的示例是上一，相同，但它会调用构造函数。The following example is identical to the previous one, except that it calls the constructor. 此版本的`ExecuteInForeground`方法只有一个参数表示的毫秒所要执行的循环的大致数目。This version of the `ExecuteInForeground` method has a single parameter that represents the approximate number of milliseconds the loop is to execute. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/cs/ThreadStart2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/vb/ThreadStart2.vb#2)] 不需要保留对引用对象后启动线程。It is not necessary to retain a reference to a object once you have started the thread. 线程继续执行，直到线程过程完成。The thread continues to execute until the thread procedure is complete. ## 检索线程对象Retrieving Thread objects 您可以使用静态 (`Shared`在 Visual Basic 中)属性来检索对当前执行线程的线程正在执行的代码中的引用。You can use the static (`Shared` in Visual Basic) property to retrieve a reference to the currently executing thread from the code that the thread is executing. 下面的示例使用属性来显示有关主应用程序线程、 另一个前台线程、 后台线程和一个线程池线程的信息。The following example uses the property to display information about the main application thread, another foreground thread, a background thread, and a thread pool thread. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/cs/Instance1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/vb/Instance1.vb#4)] ## 前台和后台线程Foreground and background threads 实例类表示前台线程或后台线程。Instances of the class represent either foreground threads or background threads. 后台线程相等前台线程有一个例外： 后台线程不会保留正运行的进程，如果所有前台线程已都终止。Background threads are identical to foreground threads with one exception: a background thread does not keep a process running if all foreground threads have terminated. 所有前台线程已都停止后，运行时将停止所有后台线程，并关闭。Once all foreground threads have been stopped, the runtime stops all background threads and shuts down. 默认情况下，以下线程在前台执行：By default, the following threads execute in the foreground: - 主应用程序中的线程。The main application thread. - 通过调用创建的所有线程类构造函数。All threads created by calling a class constructor. 默认情况下，在后台执行的以下线程：The following threads execute in the background by default: - 线程池线程，是一个由运行时维护辅助线程池。Thread pool threads, which are a pool of worker threads maintained by the runtime. 可以通过使用线程池线程上配置的线程池和计划工作类。You can configure the thread pool and schedule work on thread pool threads by using the class. > [!NOTE] > 在线程池线程上自动执行基于任务的异步操作。Task-based asynchronous operations automatically execute on thread pool threads. 基于任务的异步操作使用和类以实现[基于任务的异步模式](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/task-based-asynchronous-pattern-tap.md)。Task-based asynchronous operations use the and classes to implement the [task-based asynchronous pattern](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/task-based-asynchronous-pattern-tap.md). - 从非托管代码进入托管的执行环境的所有线程。All threads that enter the managed execution environment from unmanaged code. 你可以更改线程在后台执行通过设置在任何时候的属性。You can change a thread to execute in the background by setting the property at any time. 后台线程可用于任何操作都应继续，只要应用程序正在运行，但不是应阻止应用程序终止，如监视文件系统更改或传入套接字连接。Background threads are useful for any operation that should continue as long as an application is running but should not prevent the application from terminating, such as monitoring file system changes or incoming socket connections. 下面的示例演示前景色和背景线程之间的差异。The following example illustrates the difference between foreground and background threads. 此操作就如同中的第一个示例[启动线程](#Starting)部分，只不过它将设置要在其开始之前在后台中执行的线程。It is like the first example in the [Starting a thread](#Starting) section, except that it sets the thread to execute in the background before starting it. 如输出所示，在它的五秒内执行之前中断循环。As the output shows, the loop is interrupted before it executes for five seconds. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/cs/BackgroundEx1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/vb/BackgroundEx1.vb#3)] ## 区域性和线程Culture and threads 每个线程具有区域性，由表示属性和 UI 区域性，由表示属性。Each thread has a culture, represented by the property, and a UI culture, represented by the property. 当前区域性支持分析和格式设置，字符串比较和排序，诸如区分区域性的操作，还控制书写系统和线程使用的日历。The current culture supports such culture-sensitive operations as parsing and formatting, string comparison and sorting, and also controls the writing system and calendar used by a thread. 当前 UI 区域性提供的资源文件中的资源的区分区域性的检索。The current UI culture provides for culture-sensitive retrieval of resources in resource files. 实例化一个新线程时，其区域性和 UI 区域性定义由的当前系统区域性和 UI 区域性，而不是区域性和 UI 区域性从中创建新线程的线程。When a new thread is instantiated, its culture and UI culture are defined by the current system culture and UI culture, and not by the culture and UI culture of the thread from which the new thread is created. 这意味着，例如，如果当前系统区域性为英语 （美国），主应用程序线程的当前区域性为法语 （法国），通过调用创建一个新线程的区域性从主线程的构造函数是英语 （美国） 和不是法语 （法国）。This means, for example, that if the current system culture is English (United States) and the current culture of the primary application thread is French (France), the culture of a new thread created by calling the constructor from the primary thread is English (United States), and not French (France). 有关详细信息，请参阅的"区域性和线程"部分类主题。For more information, see the "Culture and threads" section of the class topic. > [!IMPORTANT] > 这是不正确的执行该目标的应用的异步操作的线程[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]并且更高版本，在这种情况下，区域性和 UI 区域性中的属于的异步操作的上下文; 的线程上异步操作通过执行默认继承的区域性和 UI 区域性从中启动异步操作的线程。This is not true of threads that execute asynchronous operations for apps that target the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)] and later versions, In this case, the culture and UI culture is part of an asynchronous operations' context; the thread on which an asynchronous operation executes by default inherits the culture and UI culture of the thread from which the asynchronous operation was launched. 有关详细信息，请参阅 类主题中的“区域性和基于任务的异步操作”一节。For more information, see the "Culture and task-based asynchronous operations" section of the class topic. 你可以执行以下操作以确保的所有线程执行应用程序中共享相同的区域性和 UI 区域性：You can do either of the following to ensure that all of the threads executing in an application share the same culture and UI culture: - 你可以将传递对象，表示该区域性委托或方法。You can pass a object that represents that culture to the delegate or the method. - 在上运行的应用程序[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]和更高版本，你可以定义的区域性和 UI 区域性要分配给通过设置的值创建应用程序域中的所有线程和属性。For apps running on the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] and later versions, you can define the culture and UI culture that is to be assigned to all threads created in an application domain by setting the value of the and properties. 请注意这是每个应用程序域的设置。Note that this is a per-application domain setting. 有关详细信息和示例，请参阅的"区域性和线程"部分类主题。For more information and examples, see the "Culture and threads" section of the class topic. ## 获取相关信息和控制线程Getting information about and controlling threads 你可以检索提供有关线程的信息的属性值的数目。You can retrieve a number of property values that provide information about a thread. 在某些情况下，你还可以设置这些属性值可控制的操作的线程。In some cases, you can also set these property values to control the operation of the thread. 这些线程属性包括：These thread properties include: - 名称。A name. 是可写的一次可用于标识线程的属性。 is a write-once property that you can use to identify a thread. 其默认值是`null`。Its default value is `null`. - 一个哈希代码，它可以通过调用检索方法。A hash code, which you can retrieve by calling the method. 哈希代码可以用于唯一标识线程;在线程的生存期内，其哈希代码不会与来自其他线程，而不考虑从中获取值的应用程序域的值。The hash code can be used to uniquely identify a thread; for the lifetime of your thread, its hash code will not collide with the value from any other thread, regardless of the application domain from which you obtain the value. - 线程 id。A thread ID. 只读的值属性由运行时分配，并唯一地标识其进程中的线程。The value of the read-only property is assigned by the runtime and uniquely identifies a thread within its process. > [!NOTE] > 因为非托管主机可以控制托管线程和非托管线程之间的关系，所以操作系统 [ThreadId](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms683233.aspx) 与托管线程之间没有固定的关系。An operating-system [ThreadId](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms683233.aspx) has no fixed relationship to a managed thread, because an unmanaged host can control the relationship between managed and unmanaged threads. 具体而言，一个复杂的主机可以使用[CLR 托管 API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms404385.aspx)调度多个托管的线程针对同一操作系统线程，或不同的操作系统线程之间移动托管的线程。Specifically, a sophisticated host can use the [CLR Hosting API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms404385.aspx) to schedule many managed threads against the same operating system thread, or to move a managed thread between different operating system threads. - 线程的当前状态。The thread's current state. 其是否存在的持续时间内，线程是始终在一个或多个定义的状态属性。For the duration of its existence, a thread is always in one or more of the states defined by the property. - 计划的优先级别，通过定义属性。A scheduling priority level, which is defined by the property. 虽然你可以设置此值，以请求线程的优先级，但它不被保证遵循所操作系统。Although you can set this value to request a thread's priority, it is not guaranteed to be honored by the operating system. - 只读属性，它指示线程是否是一个线程池线程。The read-only property, which indicates whether a thread is a thread pool thread. - 属性。The property. 有关详细信息，请参阅[前台和后台线程](#Foreground)部分。For more information, see the [Foreground and background threads](#Foreground) section. ## Examples 下面的示例演示了简单的线程处理功能。The following example demonstrates simple threading functionality. [!code-cpp[Classic Thread Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic Thread Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic Thread Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic Thread Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic Thread Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic Thread Example/VB/source.vb#1)] 此代码生成类似于下面的输出：This code produces output similar to the following: ``` [VB, C++, C#] Main thread: Start a second thread. Main thread: Do some work. ThreadProc: 0 Main thread: Do some work. ThreadProc: 1 Main thread: Do some work. ThreadProc: 2 Main thread: Do some work. ThreadProc: 3 Main thread: Call Join(), to wait until ThreadProc ends. ThreadProc: 4 ThreadProc: 5 ThreadProc: 6 ThreadProc: 7 ThreadProc: 8 ThreadProc: 9 Main thread: ThreadProc.Join has returned. Press Enter to end program. ```

span.span: This type is thread safe.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 线程不会开始执行时创建它。A thread does not begin executing when it is created. 若要安排执行的线程，请调用方法。To schedule the thread for execution, call the method. 若要将数据对象传递给该线程，使用方法重载。To pass a data object to the thread, use the method overload. > [!NOTE] > Visual Basic 用户可以省略构造函数创建线程时。Visual Basic users can omit the constructor when creating a thread. 使用`AddressOf`运算符传递你的方法，例如时`Dim t As New Thread(AddressOf ThreadProc)`。Use the `AddressOf` operator when passing your method, for example `Dim t As New Thread(AddressOf ThreadProc)`. Visual Basic 将自动调用构造函数。Visual Basic automatically calls the constructor. ## Examples 下面的示例演示了创建和使用的语法委托，它具有一个静态方法和实例方法。The following example shows the syntax for creating and using a delegate with a static method and an instance method. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.ParameterizedThreadStart#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ParameterizedThreadStart/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.ParameterizedThreadStart#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ParameterizedThreadStart/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.ParameterizedThreadStart#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ParameterizedThreadStart/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 线程不会开始执行时创建它。A thread does not begin executing when it is created. 若要安排执行的线程，请调用方法。To schedule the thread for execution, call the method. > [!NOTE] > Visual Basic 用户可以省略构造函数创建线程时。Visual Basic users can omit the constructor when creating a thread. 使用`AddressOf`运算符，例如传递你的方法时`Dim t As New Thread(AddressOf ThreadProc)`。Use the `AddressOf` operator when passing your method for example `Dim t As New Thread(AddressOf ThreadProc)`. Visual Basic 将自动调用构造函数。Visual Basic automatically calls the constructor. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何创建线程执行的静态方法。The following code example shows how to create a thread that executes a static method. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.ctor/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.ctor/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.ctor/VB/source.vb#1)] 下面的代码示例演示如何创建执行的实例方法的线程。The following code example shows how to create a thread that executes an instance method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 避免使用此构造函数重载。Avoid using this constructor overload. 使用的默认堆栈大小构造函数重载是线程的建议的堆栈大小。The default stack size used by the constructor overload is the recommended stack size for threads. 如果一个线程出现内存问题，最可能的原因编程错误，例如无限递归。If a thread has memory problems, the most likely cause is programming error, such as infinite recursion. > [!IMPORTANT] > 开头[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]、 完全受信任的代码可以设置只`maxStackSize`为大于默认堆栈大小 （1 兆字节） 的值。Beginning with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], only fully trusted code can set `maxStackSize` to a value that is greater than the default stack size (1 megabyte). 如果为指定更大的值`maxStackSize`时使用部分信任，运行代码`maxStackSize`将被忽略，并且默认堆栈大小适用。If a larger value is specified for `maxStackSize` when code is running with partial trust, `maxStackSize` is ignored and the default stack size is used. 不引发异常。No exception is thrown. 在任何信任级别的代码可以设置`maxStackSize`为小于默认堆栈大小的值。Code at any trust level can set `maxStackSize` to a value that is less than the default stack size. > [!NOTE] > 如果你正在开发的完全受信任的库，将由部分受信任的代码，并且你需要启动线程需要大量堆栈，则必须在创建线程之前, 声明完全信任或将使用默认堆栈大小。If you are developing a fully trusted library that will be used by partially trusted code, and you need to start a thread that requires a large stack, you must assert full trust before creating the thread, or the default stack size will be used. 除非你完全控制的线程运行的代码，则请执行此操作。Do not do this unless you fully control the code that runs on the thread. 如果`maxStackSize`小于比最小的堆栈大小，使用的最小的堆栈大小。If `maxStackSize` is less than the minimum stack size, the minimum stack size is used. 如果`maxStackSize`不是倍数的页大小，将其舍入到的页大小的下一个更大倍数。If `maxStackSize` is not a multiple of the page size, it is rounded to the next larger multiple of the page size. 例如，如果在 Windows Vista 上使用.NET Framework 2.0 版，256 KB （262144 字节） 是最小的堆栈大小，和的页大小为 64 KB （65536 字节为单位）。For example, if you are using the .NET Framework version 2.0 on Windows Vista, 256KB (262,144 bytes) is the minimum stack size, and the page size is 64KB (65,536 bytes). > [!NOTE] > 在版本的 Windows XP 和 Windows Server 2003 之前的 Microsoft Windows`maxStackSize`将被忽略，并使用可执行文件的标头中指定的堆栈大小。On versions of Microsoft Windows prior to Windows XP and Windows Server 2003, `maxStackSize` is ignored, and the stack size specified in the executable header is used. 如果指定非常小的堆栈大小，你可能需要禁用堆栈溢出探测。If you specify a very small stack size, you might need to disable stack-overflow probing. 当堆栈受到严重约束时，探测可以本身导致堆栈溢出。When the stack is severely constrained, the probing can itself cause a stack overflow. 若要禁用堆栈溢出探测，到应用程序配置文件添加以下内容。To disable stack overflow probing, add the following to your application configuration file. ``` ```

threads. 如果一个线程出现内存问题，最可能的原因编程错误，例如无限递归。If a thread has memory problems, the most likely cause is programming error, such as infinite recursion. > [!IMPORTANT] > remarks.format: ## Remarks 在线程上调用此方法时，系统将引发在中止的线程中。When this method is invoked on a thread, the system throws a in the thread to abort it. `ThreadAbortException` 是可由应用程序代码中，捕获特殊异常但被重新引发末尾`catch`除非阻止调用。`ThreadAbortException` is a special exception that can be caught by application code, but is re-thrown at the end of the `catch` block unless is called. `ResetAbort` 取消请求中止，并防止`ThreadAbortException`从终止此线程。`ResetAbort` cancels the request to abort, and prevents the `ThreadAbortException` from terminating the thread. 快进`finally`块执行之前在线程终止。Unexecuted `finally` blocks are executed before the thread is aborted. > [!NOTE] > 当线程调用`Abort`自身，结果类似于引发异常;立即，并且结果为可预测。When a thread calls `Abort` on itself, the effect is similar to throwing an exception; the happens immediately, and the result is predictable. 但是，如果一个线程调用`Abort`上另一线程，则将中断运行的任何代码。However, if one thread calls `Abort` on another thread, the abort interrupts whatever code is running. 此外，还有可能无法中止静态构造函数。There is also a chance that a static constructor could be aborted. 在极少数情况下，这可能会阻止在该应用程序域中创建该类的实例。In rare cases, this might prevent instances of that class from being created in that application domain. 在.NET framework 1.0 和 1.1 版中，则的可能无法中止线程时`finally`运行块，在这种情况下`finally`中止块。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, there is a chance the thread could abort while a `finally` block is running, in which case the `finally` block is aborted. 线程不能保证中止立即，要么根本。The thread is not guaranteed to abort immediately, or at all. 如果一个线程非常的大量的计算中可以出现这种情况`finally`作为终止过程，从而无限期延迟中止中调用的块。This situation can occur if a thread does an unbounded amount of computation in the `finally` blocks that are called as part of the abort procedure, thereby indefinitely delaying the abort. 若要等待，直到线程已中止，你可以调用方法在调用线程上的方法，但不能保证，等待将结束。To wait until a thread has aborted, you can call the method on the thread after calling the method, but there is no guarantee the wait will end. > [!NOTE] > 调用的线程如果正在中止的线程处于受保护的代码区域，如可能会阻止`catch`块，`finally`块或受约束的执行区域。The thread that calls might block if the thread that is being aborted is in a protected region of code, such as a `catch` block, `finally` block, or constrained execution region. 如果调用线程持有中止的线程需要，会出现死锁的锁。If the thread that calls holds a lock that the aborted thread requires, a deadlock can occur. 如果`Abort`称为上尚未启动的线程，该线程将中止时调用。If `Abort` is called on a thread that has not been started, the thread will abort when is called. 如果`Abort`调用上被阻止或正在休眠的线程，该线程中断，然后中止。If `Abort` is called on a thread that is blocked or is sleeping, the thread is interrupted and then aborted. 如果`Abort`已挂起的线程上调用调用线程中引发，和添加到正在中止的线程的属性。If `Abort` is called on a thread that has been suspended, a is thrown in the thread that called , and is added to the property of the thread being aborted. A不会在之前已挂起的线程中引发调用。A is not thrown in the suspended thread until is called. 如果`Abort`执行非托管的代码时在托管线程上调用`ThreadAbortException`直到返回到托管代码的线程不会引发。If `Abort` is called on a managed thread while it is executing unmanaged code, a `ThreadAbortException` is not thrown until the thread returns to managed code. 如果两次调用`Abort`出现在同一时间，它是用于设置的状态信息的一个调用和执行的其他调用`Abort`。If two calls to `Abort` come at the same time, it is possible for one call to set the state information and the other call to execute the `Abort`. 但是，应用程序无法检测到这种情况。However, an application cannot detect this situation. 后`Abort`调用线程的状态在一个线程上包括。After `Abort` is invoked on a thread, the state of the thread includes . 线程已终止由于成功调用后`Abort`，线程的状态更改为。After the thread has terminated as a result of a successful call to `Abort`, the state of the thread is changed to . 使用具有足够权限，线程，是目标的`Abort`可以取消中止使用`ResetAbort`方法。With sufficient permissions, a thread that is the target of an `Abort` can cancel the abort using the `ResetAbort` method. 有关示例，演示如何调用`ResetAbort`方法，请参阅`ThreadAbortException`类。For an example that demonstrates calling the `ResetAbort` method, see the `ThreadAbortException` class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > .NET Framework 提供了有关使用线程本地存储区 (TLS) 的两种机制： 线程相关的静态字段 (即，使用标记的字段属性) 和数据槽。The .NET Framework provides two mechanisms for using thread local storage (TLS): thread-relative static fields (that is, fields that are marked with the attribute) and data slots. 线程相关的静态字段提供更好的性能比数据槽，编译时类型检查。Thread-relative static fields provide much better performance than data slots, and enable compile-time type checking. 有关使用 TLS 的详细信息，请参阅[线程本地存储区： 线程相关的静态字段和数据槽](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md)。For more information about using TLS, see [Thread Local Storage: Thread-Relative Static Fields and Data Slots](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md). 所有线程上分配槽。The slot is allocated on all threads. 线程使用本地存储内存机制来存储线程特定的数据。Threads use a local store memory mechanism to store thread-specific data. 创建时，公共语言运行时分配给每个进程的多插槽数据存储数组。The common language runtime allocates a multi-slot data store array to each process when it is created. 线程可以分配数据存储区中的数据槽、 存储和检索数据的槽中值和线程过期后释放槽以供重用。The thread can allocate a data slot in the data store, store and retrieve a data value in the slot, and free the slot for reuse after the thread expires. 数据槽是每个线程的唯一的。Data slots are unique per thread. 没有其他线程 （甚至不是子线程） 可以获取该数据。No other thread (not even a child thread) can get that data. ## Examples 本部分包含两个代码示例。This section contains two code examples. 第一个示例演示如何使用字段将标有特性来保存线程特定的信息。The first example shows how to use a field that is marked with the attribute to hold thread-specific information. 第二个示例演示如何使用数据槽执行相同的操作。The second example shows how to use a data slot to do the same thing. **第一个示例****First Example** 下面的示例演示如何使用字段将标有来保存线程特定的信息。The following example shows how to use a field that is marked with to hold thread-specific information. 此方法提供更好的性能比第二个示例所示的技术。This technique provides better performance than the technique that is shown in the second example. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/vb/source.vb#1)] **第二个示例****Second Example** 下面的代码示例演示如何使用的数据槽存储线程特定的信息。The following code example demonstrates how to use a data slot to store thread-specific information. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > .NET Framework 提供了有关使用线程本地存储区 (TLS) 的两种机制： 线程相关的静态字段 (即，使用标记的字段属性) 和数据槽。The .NET Framework provides two mechanisms for using thread local storage (TLS): thread-relative static fields (that is, fields that are marked with the attribute) and data slots. 线程相关的静态字段提供更好的性能比数据槽，编译时类型检查。Thread-relative static fields provide much better performance than data slots, and enable compile-time type checking. 有关使用 TLS 的详细信息，请参阅[线程本地存储区： 线程相关的静态字段和数据槽](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md)。For more information about using TLS, see [Thread Local Storage: Thread-Relative Static Fields and Data Slots](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md). 线程使用本地存储内存机制来存储线程特定的数据。Threads use a local store memory mechanism to store thread-specific data. 创建时，公共语言运行时分配给每个进程的多插槽数据存储数组。The common language runtime allocates a multi-slot data store array to each process when it is created. 线程可以分配数据存储区中的数据槽、 存储和检索数据的槽中值和线程过期后释放槽以供重用。The thread can allocate a data slot in the data store, store and retrieve a data value in the slot, and free the slot for reuse after the thread expires. 数据槽是每个线程的唯一的。Data slots are unique per thread. 没有其他线程 （甚至不是子线程） 可以获取该数据。No other thread (not even a child thread) can get that data. 不需要使用方法，以分配的命名的数据槽，因为方法分配槽，如果尚未分配。It is not necessary to use the method to allocate a named data slot, because the method allocates the slot if it has not already been allocated. > [!NOTE] > 如果使用方法，因为它将引发异常，如果具有指定名称的槽已分配应该在程序启动时，主线程中调用它。If the method is used, it should be called in the main thread at program startup, because it throws an exception if a slot with the specified name has already been allocated. 没有方法来测试是否已分配一个槽。There is no way to test whether a slot has already been allocated. 使用此方法分配的槽必须释放与。Slots allocated with this method must be freed with . ## Examples 本部分包含两个代码示例。This section contains two code examples. 第一个示例演示如何使用字段将标有特性来保存线程特定的信息。The first example shows how to use a field that is marked with the attribute to hold thread-specific information. 第二个示例演示如何使用数据槽执行相同的操作。The second example shows how to use a data slot to do the same thing. **第一个示例****First Example** 下面的示例演示如何使用字段将标有来保存线程特定的信息。The following example shows how to use a field that is marked with to hold thread-specific information. 此方法提供更好的性能比第二个示例所示的技术。This technique provides better performance than the technique that is shown in the second example. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/vb/source.vb#1)] **第二个示例****Second Example** 下面的示例演示如何使用命名的数据槽以存储线程特定的信息。The following example demonstrates how to use a named data slot to store thread-specific information. > [!NOTE] > 此代码示例不使用方法，因为方法分配槽，如果尚未分配。The example code does not use the method, because the method allocates the slot if it has not already been allocated. 如果方法时，应在程序启动主线程中调用它。If the method is used, it should be called in the main thread at program startup. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks **属性已过时。****The property is obsolete.** 未过时的替代项为方法来检索其中的单元状态和方法以设置单元状态。The non-obsolete alternatives are the method to retrieve the apartment state and the method to set the apartment state. 在.NET framework 1.0 和 1.1 中，`ApartmentState`属性标记的线程以指示它将在单线程还是多线程单元中执行。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, the `ApartmentState` property marks a thread to indicate that it will execute in a single-threaded or multithreaded apartment. 可以设置此属性，当线程处于`Unstarted`或`Running`线程状态; 但是，它可以只能设置一次一个线程。This property can be set when the thread is in the `Unstarted` or `Running` thread state; however, it can be set only once for a thread. 如果尚未设置属性，它将返回`Unknown`。If the property has not been set, it returns `Unknown`. 尝试使用忽略属性设置已设置其单元状态的线程的单元状态。An attempt to use the property to set the apartment state of a thread whose apartment state has already been set is ignored. 但是，方法抛出异常在这种情况下。However, the method throws a in this case. > [!IMPORTANT] > 在.NET Framework 2.0 版中，新的线程将初始化为如果它们启动之前尚未设置其单元状态。In the .NET Framework version 2.0, new threads are initialized as if their apartment state has not been set before they are started. 主应用程序线程被初始化为默认情况下。The main application thread is initialized to by default. 你无法再设置的主应用程序线程通过设置代码的第一行上的属性。You can no longer set the main application thread to by setting the property on the first line of code. 使用相反。Use the instead. 在.NET Framework 2.0 版中，你可以指定的 COM 线程模型为 c + + 应用程序使用[/CLRTHREADATTRIBUTE （设置 CLR 线程特性）](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4907e9ef-5031-446c-aecf-0a0b32fae1e8)链接器选项。In the .NET Framework version 2.0, you can specify the COM threading model for a C++ application using the [/CLRTHREADATTRIBUTE (Set CLR Thread Attribute)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4907e9ef-5031-446c-aecf-0a0b32fae1e8) linker option. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何设置线程的单元状态。The following code example demonstrates how to set the apartment state of a thread. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.ApartmentState#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.ApartmentState/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.ApartmentState#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.ApartmentState/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.ApartmentState#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.ApartmentState/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static void BeginCriticalRegion ();
.method public static hidebysig void BeginCriticalRegion() cil managed
Public Shared Sub BeginCriticalRegion ()
public: static void BeginCriticalRegion();

summary.span: 通知宿主执行将要进入一个代码区域，在该代码区域内线程中止或未经处理异常的影响可能会危害应用程序域中的其他任务。

span.span: Notifies a host that execution is about to enter a region of code in which the effects of a thread abort or unhandled exception might jeopardize other tasks in the application domain.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 公共语言运行时 (CLR)，如 Microsoft SQL Server 2005，主机可以建立不同的策略中的代码的关键和非关键区域的故障。Hosts of the common language runtime (CLR), such as Microsoft SQL Server 2005, can establish different policies for failures in critical and non-critical regions of code. 关键区域是一个线程中止或未经处理的异常的影响可能会不限于当前任务。A critical region is one in which the effects of a thread abort or an unhandled exception might not be limited to the current task. 与此相反，中止或非关键区域的代码中的失败会影响仅在其中出错的任务。By contrast, an abort or failure in a non-critical region of code affects only the task in which the error occurs. 例如，考虑一个尝试持有的锁时分配内存的任务。For example, consider a task that attempts to allocate memory while holding a lock. 如果内存分配失败，正在中止当前任务不能确保稳定性，因为在等待相同的锁的域可以是其他任务。If the memory allocation fails, aborting the current task is not sufficient to ensure stability of the , because there can be other tasks in the domain waiting for the same lock. 如果当前任务将被终止，则其他任务无法死锁。If the current task is terminated, other tasks could be deadlocked. 在关键区域中发生故障，主机可能会决定是否要卸载整个而不是在可能不稳定状态中继续执行的风险。When a failure occurs in a critical region, the host might decide to unload the entire rather than take the risk of continuing execution in a potentially unstable state. 若要通知宿主代码正在进入关键区域，调用。To inform the host that your code is entering a critical region, call . 调用当执行返回到代码的非关键区域。Call when execution returns to a non-critical region of code. 在 SQL Server 2005 下运行的代码中使用此方法需要要在最高的主机保护级别运行的代码。Using this method in code that runs under SQL Server 2005 requires the code to be run at the highest host protection level. ## Examples 下面的示例演示了利用和方法将划分为关键和非关键区域的代码块。The following example demonstrates the use of the and methods to divide a block of code into critical and non-critical regions. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: 通知主机托管代码将要执行依赖于当前物理操作系统线程的标识的指令。

span.span: Notifies a host that managed code is about to execute instructions that depend on the identity of the current physical operating system thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 公共语言运行时，如 Microsoft SQL Server 2005，某些主机提供其自己的线程管理。Some hosts of the common language runtime, such as Microsoft SQL Server 2005, provide their own thread management. 提供其自己的线程管理的主机可以正在执行的任务在一个物理操作系统线程之间移动在任何时间。A host that provides its own thread management can move an executing task from one physical operating system thread to another at any time. 大多数任务不受这种切换。Most tasks are not affected by this switching. 但是，某些任务具有线程关联 — 也就是说，它们依赖于物理操作系统线程的标识。However, some tasks have thread affinity - that is, they depend on the identity of a physical operating system thread. 这些任务必须通知宿主在其执行不会切换的代码。These tasks must inform the host when they execute code that should not be switched. 例如，如果应用程序调用一个系统 API 来获取操作系统锁定具有线程关联，例如 Win32 CRITICAL_SECTION 中，必须调用之前获取锁，和后释放锁。For example, if your application calls a system API to acquire an operating system lock that has thread affinity, such as a Win32 CRITICAL_SECTION, you must call before acquiring the lock, and after releasing the lock. 在 SQL Server 2005 下运行的代码中使用此方法需要要在最高的主机保护级别运行的代码。Using this method in code that runs under SQL Server 2005 requires the code to be run at the highest host protection level. ## Examples 下面的示例演示了利用和方法用于通知的代码块取决于物理操作系统线程的标识的主机。The following example demonstrates the use of the and methods to notify a host that a block of code depends on the identity of a physical operating system thread. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity/VB/source.vb#1)]

span.span: An object that represents the culture for the current thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 以及其关联的对象，此属性所返回的对象确定的日期的默认格式、 时间、 数字、 货币值，排序顺序的文本、 大小写约定，和的字符串比较。The object that is returned by this property, together with its associated objects, determine the default format for dates, times, numbers, currency values, the sorting order of text, casing conventions, and string comparisons. 请参阅类若要了解有关区域性名称和标识符，固定，非特定，和特定区域性之间的差异和区域性信息的方式会影响线程和应用程序域。See the class to learn about culture names and identifiers, the differences between invariant, neutral, and specific cultures, and the way culture information affects threads and application domains. 请参阅属性以了解如何确定线程的默认区域性，以及用户如何设置其计算机的区域性信息。See the property to learn how a thread's default culture is determined, and how users set culture information for their computers. 开头[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]，你可以设置属性设置为非特定区域性。Beginning with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], you can set the property to a neutral culture. 这是因为的行为类已更改： 时，它表示非特定区域性，其属性值 (具体而言， ， ， ， ，和属性) 现在反映与非特定区域性关联的特定区域性。This is because the behavior of the class has changed: When it represents a neutral culture, its property values (in particular, the , , , , and properties) now reflect the specific culture that is associated with the neutral culture. 在早期版本的.NET Framework 中，属性引发异常时分配的非特定区域性。In earlier versions of the .NET Framework, the property threw a exception when a neutral culture was assigned. ## Examples 下面的代码示例显示允许 Windows 窗体，以显示在控制面板中设置的区域性中的用户界面的线程处理语句。The following code example shows the threading statement that allows the user interface of a Windows Forms to display in the culture that is set in Control Panel. 需要附加代码。Additional code is needed. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.Culture#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.Culture/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.Culture#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.Culture/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.Culture#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.Culture/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Examples 下面的示例创建反过来创建 20 个的子任务的任务。The following example creates a task that in turn creates 20 child tasks. 在应用程序本身，作为很好地为每个任务中，调用`ShowThreadInformation`方法，它使用属性来显示有关在其运行的线程的信息。The application itself, as well as each task, calls the `ShowThreadInformation` method, which uses the property to display information about the thread on which it is running. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.thread.currentthread/cs/currentthread2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.thread.currentthread/vb/currentthread2.vb#1)] 每个子任务生成 1 亿个随机数字，介于 1 和 100 万个，并返回其平均值。Each child task generates 1 million random numbers between 1 and 1 million and returns their mean. 父任务调用方法，以确保子任务已完成之前显示每个任务返回的平均值和计算平均值的平均值。The parent task calls the method to ensure that the child tasks have completed before displaying the mean returned by each task and calculating the mean of means. 请注意，当应用程序运行在前台线程上时，每个任务运行在线程池线程上。Note that while the application runs on a foreground thread, each task runs on a thread pool thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks UI 区域性指定应用程序需要支持用户输入和输出，以及默认情况下与操作系统区域性相同的资源。The UI culture specifies the resources an application needs to support user input and output, and by default is the same as the operating system culture. 请参阅类若要了解有关区域性名称和标识符，固定，非特定，和特定区域性之间的差异和区域性信息的方式会影响线程和应用程序域。See the class to learn about culture names and identifiers, the differences between invariant, neutral, and specific cultures, and the way culture information affects threads and application domains. 请参阅属性若要了解如何确定线程的默认 UI 区域性。See the property to learn how a thread's default UI culture is determined. 返回此属性可以是一个非特定区域性。The returned by this property can be a neutral culture. 非特定区域性不应与等格式设置方法， ，和。Neutral cultures should not be used with formatting methods such as , , and . 使用方法以获取特定区域性，或者使用属性。Use the method to get a specific culture, or use the property. > [!NOTE] > 方法抛出异常非特定区域性"此不同 ("ZH-CHT") 和"中文-Hans"("ZH-CHS")。The method throws for the neutral cultures "zh-Hant" ("zh-CHT") and "zh-Hans" ("zh-CHS"). ## Examples 下面的示例确定是否当前线程的 UI 区域性的语言为法语。The following example determines whether the language of the current thread's UI culture is French. 如果不是这样，它会将当前线程的 UI 区域性设置为英语 （美国）。If it is not, it sets the UI culture of the current thread to English (United States). [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.CurrentUICulture#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread.CurrentUICulture/cs/CurrentUICulture1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.CurrentUICulture#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread.CurrentUICulture/vb/CurrentUICulture1.vb#1)] 下面的代码示例显示允许 Windows 窗体，以显示在控制面板中设置的区域性中的用户界面的线程处理语句。The following code example shows the threading statement that allows the user interface of a Windows Forms to display in the culture that is set in Control Panel. 需要附加代码。Additional code is needed. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.Culture#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.Culture/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.Culture#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.Culture/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.Culture#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.Culture/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: 对于当前线程关闭运行时可调用包装 (RCW) 的自动清理。

span.span: Turns off automatic cleanup of runtime callable wrappers (RCW) for the current thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，公共语言运行时 (CLR) 运行时可调用包装器会自动清理。By default, the common language runtime (CLR) cleans up runtime callable wrappers automatically. 在清除，这可能会导致某些应用程序的可重入性问题的过程的 CLR 泵消息满足以下异常条件：The CLR pumps messages during the cleanup, which might cause reentrancy problems for a few applications that meet the following unusual criteria: - 应用程序执行自己消息泵处理。The application does its own message pumping. - 应用程序需要精确地控制何时消息泵处理时发生。The application needs to control precisely when message pumping occurs. 此类应用程序可以使用方法，以防止 CLR 执行自动回收的运行时可调用包装器。Such applications can use the method to prevent the CLR from doing automatic reclamation of runtime callable wrappers. 当已在一个线程上调用此方法时，自动清理无法重新启用该线程。When this method has been called on a thread, automatic cleanup cannot be re-enabled for that thread. 准备好清理运行时可调用包装你的应用程序时，请使用方法，以指示运行时清理当前上下文中的所有运行时可调用包装。When your application is ready to clean up runtime callable wrappers, use the method to instruct the runtime to clean up all runtime callable wrappers in the current context. 该方法将执行时发生消息泵处理。Message pumping occurs while the method executes.

summary.span: 通知宿主执行将要进入一个代码区域，在该代码区域内线程中止或未经处理异常的影响限于当前任务。

span.span: Notifies a host that execution is about to enter a region of code in which the effects of a thread abort or unhandled exception are limited to the current task.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 公共语言运行时 (CLR)，如 Microsoft SQL Server 2005，主机可以建立不同的策略中的代码的关键和非关键区域的故障。Hosts of the common language runtime (CLR), such as Microsoft SQL Server 2005, can establish different policies for failures in critical and non-critical regions of code. 关键区域是一个线程中止或未经处理的异常的影响可能会不限于当前任务。A critical region is one in which the effects of a thread abort or an unhandled exception might not be limited to the current task. 与此相反，中止或非关键区域的代码中的失败会影响仅在其中出错的任务。By contrast, an abort or failure in a non-critical region of code affects only the task in which the error occurs. 例如，考虑一个尝试持有的锁时分配内存的任务。For example, consider a task that attempts to allocate memory while holding a lock. 如果内存分配失败，正在中止当前任务不能确保稳定性，因为在等待相同的锁的域可以是其他任务。If the memory allocation fails, aborting the current task is not sufficient to ensure stability of the , because there can be other tasks in the domain waiting for the same lock. 如果当前任务将被终止，则其他任务无法死锁。If the current task is terminated, other tasks could be deadlocked. 在关键区域中发生故障，主机可能会决定是否要卸载整个而不是在可能不稳定状态中继续执行的风险。When a failure occurs in a critical region, the host might decide to unload the entire rather than take the risk of continuing execution in a potentially unstable state. 若要通知宿主代码正在进入关键区域，调用。To inform the host that your code is entering a critical region, call . 调用当执行返回到代码的非关键区域。Call when execution returns to a non-critical region of code. 在 SQL Server 2005 下运行的代码中使用此方法需要要在最高的主机保护级别运行的代码。Using this method in code that runs under SQL Server 2005 requires the code to be run at the highest host protection level. ## Examples 下面的示例演示了利用和方法将划分为关键和非关键区域的代码块。The following example demonstrates the use of the and methods to divide a block of code into critical and non-critical regions. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginCriticalRegion/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: 通知宿主托管代码已执行完依赖于当前物理操作系统线程的标识的指令。

span.span: Notifies a host that managed code has finished executing instructions that depend on the identity of the current physical operating system thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 公共语言运行时，如 Microsoft SQL Server 2005，某些主机提供其自己的线程管理。Some hosts of the common language runtime, such as Microsoft SQL Server 2005, provide their own thread management. 提供其自己的线程管理的主机可以正在执行的任务在一个物理操作系统线程之间移动在任何时间。A host that provides its own thread management can move an executing task from one physical operating system thread to another at any time. 大多数任务不受这种切换。Most tasks are not affected by this switching. 但是，某些任务具有线程关联 — 也就是说，它们依赖于物理操作系统线程的标识。However, some tasks have thread affinity - that is, they depend on the identity of a physical operating system thread. 这些任务必须通知宿主在其执行不会切换的代码。These tasks must inform the host when they execute code that should not be switched. 例如，如果应用程序调用一个系统 API 来获取操作系统锁定具有线程关联，例如 Win32 CRITICAL_SECTION 中，必须调用之前获取锁，和后释放锁。For example, if your application calls a system API to acquire an operating system lock that has thread affinity, such as a Win32 CRITICAL_SECTION, you must call before acquiring the lock, and after releasing the lock. 在 SQL Server 2005 下运行的代码中使用此方法需要要在最高的主机保护级别运行的代码。Using this method in code that runs under SQL Server 2005 requires the code to be run at the highest host protection level. ## Examples 下面的示例演示了利用和方法用于通知的代码块取决于物理操作系统线程的标识的主机。The following example demonstrates the use of the and methods to notify a host that a block of code depends on the identity of a physical operating system thread. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.BeginThreadAffinity/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > .NET Framework 提供了有关使用线程本地存储区 (TLS) 的两种机制： 线程相关的静态字段 (即，使用标记的字段属性) 和数据槽。The .NET Framework provides two mechanisms for using thread local storage (TLS): thread-relative static fields (that is, fields that are marked with the attribute) and data slots. 线程相关的静态字段提供更好的性能比数据槽，编译时类型检查。Thread-relative static fields provide much better performance than data slots, and enable compile-time type checking. 有关使用 TLS 的详细信息，请参阅[线程本地存储区： 线程相关的静态字段和数据槽](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md)。For more information about using TLS, see [Thread Local Storage: Thread-Relative Static Fields and Data Slots](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md). 任何线程调用后`FreeNamedDataSlot`，调用的其他任何线程具有相同名称将分配一个与名称关联的新槽。After any thread calls `FreeNamedDataSlot`, any other thread that calls with the same name will allocate a new slot associated with the name. 后续调用`GetNamedDataSlot`任何线程将返回新的槽。Subsequent calls to `GetNamedDataSlot` by any thread will return the new slot. 但是，任何线程仍具有返回到以前通过调用`GetNamedDataSlot`可以继续使用旧的槽。However, any thread that still has a returned by an earlier call to `GetNamedDataSlot` can continue to use the old slot. 发布已与名称关联的槽仅当每个`LocalDataStoreSlot`之前对的调用获得的`FreeNamedDataSlot`已被释放并垃圾回收。A slot that has been associated with a name is released only when every `LocalDataStoreSlot` that was obtained prior to the call to `FreeNamedDataSlot` has been released and garbage-collected. 线程使用本地存储内存机制来存储线程特定的数据。Threads use a local store memory mechanism to store thread-specific data. 创建时，公共语言运行时分配给每个进程的多插槽数据存储数组。The common language runtime allocates a multi-slot data store array to each process when it is created. 线程可以分配数据存储区中的数据槽、 存储和检索数据的槽中值和线程过期后释放槽以供重用。The thread can allocate a data slot in the data store, store and retrieve a data value in the slot, and free the slot for reuse after the thread expires. 数据槽是每个线程的唯一的。Data slots are unique per thread. 没有其他线程 （甚至不是子线程） 可以获取该数据。No other thread (not even a child thread) can get that data. ## Examples 本部分包含两个代码示例。This section contains two code examples. 第一个示例演示如何使用字段将标有特性来保存线程特定的信息。The first example shows how to use a field that is marked with the attribute to hold thread-specific information. 第二个示例演示如何使用数据槽执行相同的操作。The second example shows how to use a data slot to do the same thing. **第一个示例****First Example** 下面的示例演示如何使用字段将标有来保存线程特定的信息。The following example shows how to use a field that is marked with to hold thread-specific information. 此方法提供更好的性能比第二个示例所示的技术。This technique provides better performance than the technique that is shown in the second example. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/vb/source.vb#1)] **第二个示例****Second Example** 下面的示例演示如何使用命名的数据槽以存储线程特定的信息。The following example demonstrates how to use a named data slot to store thread-specific information. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > .NET Framework 提供了有关使用线程本地存储区 (TLS) 的两种机制： 线程相关的静态字段 (即，使用标记的字段属性) 和数据槽。The .NET Framework provides two mechanisms for using thread local storage (TLS): thread-relative static fields (that is, fields that are marked with the attribute) and data slots. 线程相关的静态字段提供更好的性能比数据槽，编译时类型检查。Thread-relative static fields provide much better performance than data slots, and enable compile-time type checking. 有关使用 TLS 的详细信息，请参阅[线程本地存储区： 线程相关的静态字段和数据槽](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md)。For more information about using TLS, see [Thread Local Storage: Thread-Relative Static Fields and Data Slots](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md). 线程使用本地存储内存机制来存储线程特定的数据。Threads use a local store memory mechanism to store thread-specific data. 创建时，公共语言运行时分配给每个进程的多插槽数据存储数组。The common language runtime allocates a multi-slot data store array to each process when it is created. 线程可以分配数据存储区中的数据槽、 存储和检索数据的槽中值和线程过期后释放槽以供重用。The thread can allocate a data slot in the data store, store and retrieve a data value in the slot, and free the slot for reuse after the thread expires. 数据槽是每个线程的唯一的。Data slots are unique per thread. 没有其他线程 （甚至不是子线程） 可以获取该数据。No other thread (not even a child thread) can get that data. > [!NOTE] > 是`Shared`始终将应用于当前正在执行的线程，即使你在调用它使用另一个线程是指变量的方法。 is a `Shared` method that always applies to the currently executing thread, even if you call it using a variable that refers to another thread. 为了避免混淆，使用调用时`Shared`方法： `Dim test As Object = Thread.GetData(testSlot)`。To avoid confusion, use the class name when calling `Shared` methods: `Dim test As Object = Thread.GetData(testSlot)`. ## Examples 本部分包含两个代码示例。This section contains two code examples. 第一个示例演示如何使用字段将标有特性来保存线程特定的信息。The first example shows how to use a field that is marked with the attribute to hold thread-specific information. 第二个示例演示如何使用数据槽执行相同的操作。The second example shows how to use a data slot to do the same thing. **第一个示例****First Example** 下面的示例演示如何使用字段将标有来保存线程特定的信息。The following example shows how to use a field that is marked with to hold thread-specific information. 此方法提供更好的性能比第二个示例所示的技术。This technique provides better performance than the technique that is shown in the second example. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/vb/source.vb#1)] **第二个示例****Second Example** 下面的示例演示如何使用的数据槽以存储线程特定的信息。The following example demonstrates how to use a data slot to store thread-specific information. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.DataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DataSlot/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.DataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DataSlot/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.DataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DataSlot/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > .NET Framework 提供了有关使用线程本地存储区 (TLS) 的两种机制： 线程相关的静态字段 (即，使用标记的字段属性) 和数据槽。The .NET Framework provides two mechanisms for using thread local storage (TLS): thread-relative static fields (that is, fields that are marked with the attribute) and data slots. 线程相关的静态字段提供更好的性能比数据槽，编译时类型检查。Thread-relative static fields provide much better performance than data slots, and enable compile-time type checking. 有关使用 TLS 的详细信息，请参阅[线程本地存储区： 线程相关的静态字段和数据槽](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md)。For more information about using TLS, see [Thread Local Storage: Thread-Relative Static Fields and Data Slots](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md). 线程使用本地存储内存机制来存储线程特定的数据。Threads use a local store memory mechanism to store thread-specific data. 创建时，公共语言运行时分配给每个进程的多插槽数据存储数组。The common language runtime allocates a multi-slot data store array to each process when it is created. 线程可以分配数据存储区中的数据槽、 存储和检索数据的槽中值和线程过期后释放槽以供重用。The thread can allocate a data slot in the data store, store and retrieve a data value in the slot, and free the slot for reuse after the thread expires. 数据槽是每个线程的唯一的。Data slots are unique per thread. 没有其他线程 （甚至不是子线程） 可以获取该数据。No other thread (not even a child thread) can get that data. 如果命名的槽不存在，将分配新的槽。If the named slot does not exist, a new slot is allocated. 命名的数据槽都是公开的并可操作的任何人。Named data slots are public and can be manipulated by anyone. ## Examples 本部分包含两个代码示例。This section contains two code examples. 第一个示例演示如何使用字段将标有特性来保存线程特定的信息。The first example shows how to use a field that is marked with the attribute to hold thread-specific information. 第二个示例演示如何使用数据槽执行相同的操作。The second example shows how to use a data slot to do the same thing. **第一个示例****First Example** 下面的示例演示如何使用字段将标有来保存线程特定的信息。The following example shows how to use a field that is marked with to hold thread-specific information. 此方法提供更好的性能比第二个示例所示的技术。This technique provides better performance than the technique that is shown in the second example. summary.span: 中断处于 线程状态的线程。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果在等待、 休眠或联接状态，此线程不当前被阻塞，则下次开始阻止时它将被中断。If this thread is not currently blocked in a wait, sleep, or join state, it will be interrupted when it next begins to block. 在已中断线程，但此线程受到阻止之后才引发。 is thrown in the interrupted thread, but not until the thread blocks. 如果线程永远不会阻止，永远不会引发异常，并因此线程可能完成而不被中断。If the thread never blocks, the exception is never thrown, and thus the thread might complete without ever being interrupted. ## Examples 在中断并随后被阻止时，下面的代码示例将显示正在运行的线程的行为。The following code example shows the behavior of a running thread when it is interrupted and subsequently gets blocked. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.Interrupt#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.Interrupt/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.Interrupt#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.Interrupt/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.Interrupt#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.Interrupt/VB/source.vb#1)]

value.span: 如果此线程为或将成为后台线程，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if this thread is or is to become a background thread; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 线程是后台线程或前台线程。A thread is either a background thread or a foreground thread. 后台线程均与前台线程相同，只不过后台线程不会阻止进程终止。Background threads are identical to foreground threads, except that background threads do not prevent a process from terminating. 属于某个进程的所有前台线程已都终止，公共语言运行时结束该进程。Once all foreground threads belonging to a process have terminated, the common language runtime ends the process. 任何剩余的后台线程已停止，并不会完成。Any remaining background threads are stopped and do not complete. 默认情况下，以下线程执行在前台 (即，其属性返回`false`):By default, the following threads execute in the foreground (that is, their property returns `false`): - 主线程 （或主应用程序线程）。The primary thread (or main application thread). - 通过调用创建的所有线程类构造函数。All threads created by calling a class constructor. 默认情况下，以下线程在后台执行 (即，其属性返回`true`):By default, the following threads execute in the background (that is, their property returns `true`): - 线程池线程，是一个由运行时维护辅助线程池。Thread pool threads, which are a pool of worker threads maintained by the runtime. 可以通过使用线程池线程上配置的线程池和计划工作类。You can configure the thread pool and schedule work on thread pool threads by using the class. > [!NOTE] > 在线程池线程上自动执行基于任务的异步操作。Task-based asynchronous operations automatically execute on thread pool threads. - 从非托管代码进入托管的执行环境的所有线程。All threads that enter the managed execution environment from unmanaged code. ## Examples 下面的示例对比前台和后台线程的行为。The following example contrasts the behavior of foreground and background threads. 它将创建一个前台线程和后台线程。It creates a foreground thread and a background thread. 前台线程前让进程一直运行，直到完成其`for`循环并终止。The foreground thread keeps the process running until completes its `for` loop and terminates. 但是，如示例输出所示，因为前台线程已完成执行，后台线程完成执行之前，已终止进程。However, as the output from the example shows, because the foreground thread has finished execution, the process is terminated before the background thread has completed execution. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.IsBackground#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.IsBackground/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.IsBackground#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.IsBackground/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.IsBackground#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.IsBackground/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: 在继续执行标准的 COM 和 消息泵处理期间，阻止调用线程，直到由该实例表示的线程终止。

span.span: Blocks the calling thread until the thread represented by this instance terminates, while continuing to perform standard COM and pumping.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种同步方法，阻止调用线程 （即，调用的方法的线程），直到线程其方法调用已完成。 is a synchronization method that blocks the calling thread (that is, the thread that calls the method) until the thread whose method is called has completed. 使用此方法以确保线程已终止。Use this method to ensure that a thread has been terminated. 如果线程不会终止，调用方将无限期阻止。The caller will block indefinitely if the thread does not terminate. 在下面的示例中，`Thread1`线程调用方法`Thread2`，这将导致`Thread1`到之前的块`Thread2`已完成。In the following example, the `Thread1` thread calls the method of `Thread2`, which causes `Thread1` to block until `Thread2` has completed. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.Join#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.thread.join/cs/join1a.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.Join#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.thread.join/vb/join1a.vb#1)] 如果线程已终止时调用时，该方法将立即返回。If the thread has already terminated when is called, the method returns immediately. > [!WARNING] > 你应永远不会调用方法对象，表示来自当前线程的当前线程。You should never call the method of the object that represents the current thread from the current thread. 这将导致您的应用程序挂起，因为当前线程自身无限期等待This causes your app to hang because the current thread waits upon itself indefinitely, 此方法要包括的调用线程的状态更改。This method changes the state of the calling thread to include . 不能调用`Join`中的线程上状态。You cannot invoke `Join` on a thread that is in the state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种同步方法，阻止调用线程 （即，调用的方法的线程），直到任一线程其方法调用已完成或超时间隔已过去。 is a synchronization method that blocks the calling thread (that is, the thread that calls the method) until either the thread whose method is called has completed or the time-out interval has elapsed. 在下面的示例中，`Thread1`线程调用方法`Thread2`，这将导致`Thread1`阻止直到`Thread2`已完成或 2 秒。In the following example, the `Thread1` thread calls the method of `Thread2`, which causes `Thread1` to block either until `Thread2` has completed or 2 seconds have elapsed. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.Join#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.thread.join/cs/join1b.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.Join#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.thread.join/vb/join1b.vb#2)] 如果为指定`millisecondsTimeout`参数，此方法的行为相同与方法重载，只是返回值。If is specified for the `millisecondsTimeout` parameter, this method behaves identically to the method overload, except for the return value. 如果线程已终止时调用时，该方法将立即返回。If the thread has already terminated when is called, the method returns immediately. 此方法要包括的调用线程的状态更改。This method changes the state of the calling thread to include . 不能调用`Join`中的线程上状态。You cannot invoke `Join` on a thread that is in the state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > .NET Framework 提供了有关使用线程本地存储区 (TLS) 的两种机制： 线程相关的静态字段 (即，使用标记的字段属性) 和数据槽。The .NET Framework provides two mechanisms for using thread local storage (TLS): thread-relative static fields (that is, fields that are marked with the attribute) and data slots. 线程相关的静态字段提供更好的性能比数据槽，编译时类型检查。Thread-relative static fields provide much better performance than data slots, and enable compile-time type checking. 有关使用 TLS 的详细信息，请参阅[线程本地存储区： 线程相关的静态字段和数据槽](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md)。For more information about using TLS, see [Thread Local Storage: Thread-Relative Static Fields and Data Slots](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md). 线程使用本地存储内存机制来存储线程特定的数据。Threads use a local store memory mechanism to store thread-specific data. 创建时，公共语言运行时分配给每个进程的多插槽数据存储数组。The common language runtime allocates a multi-slot data store array to each process when it is created. 线程可以分配数据存储区中的数据槽、 存储和检索数据的槽中值和释放线程过程结束之后的槽以重用和垃圾回收功能回收对象。The thread can allocate a data slot in the data store, store and retrieve a data value in the slot, and free the slot for reuse after the thread procedure ends and the object has been reclaimed by garbage collection. 数据槽是每个线程的唯一的。Data slots are unique per thread. 没有其他线程 （甚至不是子线程） 可以获取该数据。No other thread (not even a child thread) can get that data. > [!NOTE] > 是`Shared`始终将应用于当前正在执行的线程，即使你在调用它使用另一个线程是指变量的方法。 is a `Shared` method that always applies to the currently executing thread, even if you call it using a variable that refers to another thread. 为了避免混淆，使用调用时`Shared`方法： `Thread.SetData(testSlot, "test data")`。To avoid confusion, use the class name when calling `Shared` methods: `Thread.SetData(testSlot, "test data")`. ## Examples 本部分包含两个代码示例。This section contains two code examples. 第一个示例演示如何使用字段将标有特性来保存线程特定的信息。The first example shows how to use a field that is marked with the attribute to hold thread-specific information. 第二个示例演示如何使用数据槽执行相同的操作。The second example shows how to use a data slot to do the same thing. **第一个示例****First Example** 下面的示例演示如何使用字段将标有来保存线程特定的信息。The following example shows how to use a field that is marked with to hold thread-specific information. 此方法提供更好的性能比第二个示例所示的技术。This technique provides better performance than the technique that is shown in the second example. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.DoNotUseDataSlots/vb/source.vb#1)] **第二个示例****Second Example** 下面的示例演示如何使用命名的数据槽以存储线程特定的信息。The following example demonstrates how to use a named data slot to store thread-specific information. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Thread.NamedDataSlot/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 该线程将不会计划执行由操作系统指定的时间。The thread will not be scheduled for execution by the operating system for the amount of time specified. 此方法要包括的线程的状态更改。This method changes the state of the thread to include . 你可以指定为`millisecondsTimeout`无限期挂起线程的参数。You can specify for the `millisecondsTimeout` parameter to suspend the thread indefinitely. 但是，我们建议你使用其他类，如， ， ，或改为小心地同步线程或管理资源。However, we recommend that you use other classes such as , , , or instead to sychronize threads or manage resources. 以特定速度系统时钟计时周期调用时钟分辨率。The system clock ticks at a specific rate called the clock resolution. 实际超时可能不完全指定的超时，因为指定的超时将调整与时钟计时周期保持一致。The actual timeout might not be exactly the specified timeout, because the specified timeout will be adjusted to coincide with clock ticks. 时钟分辨率和等待时间的详细信息，请参阅[睡眠函数](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms686298.aspx)主题。For more information on clock resolution and the waiting time, see the [Sleep function](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms686298.aspx) topic. 此方法调用[睡眠函数](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms686298.aspx)从 Windows 系统 Api。This method calls the [Sleep function](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms686298.aspx) from the Windows system APIs. 此方法不执行标准的 COM 和 sendmessage 消息泵处理。This method does not perform standard COM and SendMessage pumping. > [!NOTE] > 如果你需要具有的线程上休眠，但你想要执行标准的 COM 和 sendmessage 消息泵处理，请考虑使用的重载之一方法，它指定超时间隔。If you need to sleep on a thread that has , but you want to perform standard COM and SendMessage pumping, consider using one of the overloads of the method that specifies a timeout interval. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法进行阻止，应用程序的主线程。The following example uses the method to block the application's main thread. [!code-cpp[Thread.Sleep#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/thread.sleep/cpp/example.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Thread.Sleep#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/thread.sleep/cs/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Thread.Sleep#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/thread.sleep/vb/example.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 该线程将不会计划执行由操作系统指定的时间。The thread will not be scheduled for execution by the operating system for the amount of time specified. 此方法要包括的线程的状态更改。This method changes the state of the thread to include . 你可以指定为`timeout`无限期挂起线程的参数。You can specify for the `timeout` parameter to suspend the thread indefinitely. 但是，我们建议你使用其他类，如， ， ，或改为小心地同步线程或管理资源。However, we recommend that you use other classes such as , , , or instead to sychronize threads or manage resources. 此重载使用中的整毫秒总数`timeout`。This overload of uses the total number of whole milliseconds in `timeout`. 毫秒的小数部分将被丢弃。Fractional milliseconds are discarded. 此方法不执行标准的 COM 和 sendmessage 消息泵处理。This method does not perform standard COM and SendMessage pumping. > [!NOTE] > 如果你需要具有的线程上休眠，但你想要执行标准的 COM 和 sendmessage 消息泵处理，请考虑使用的重载之一方法，它指定超时间隔。If you need to sleep on a thread that has , but you want to perform standard COM and SendMessage pumping, consider using one of the overloads of the method that specifies a timeout interval. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法重载将阻止应用程序的主线程五次，2 秒钟，每次。The following example uses the method overload to block the application's main thread five times, for two seconds each time. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可用于实现锁。The method is useful for implementing locks. 类在.NET Framework 中，如和，内部使用此方法。Classes in the .NET Framework, such as and , use this method internally. 实质上是将处理器放入非常紧凑循环中，使用指定的循环计数`iterations`参数。 essentially puts the processor into a very tight loop, with the loop count specified by the `iterations` parameter. 因此，等待的持续时间取决于处理器的速度。The duration of the wait therefore depends on the speed of the processor. 与此对比方法。Contrast this with the method. 调用线程产生的处理器时间，其当前切片的其余部分，即使指定的时间间隔为零。A thread that calls yields the rest of its current slice of processor time, even if the specified interval is zero. 指定一个非零的间隔值从线程计划程序会不考虑中移除线程，直到经过的时间间隔。Specifying a non-zero interval for removes the thread from consideration by the thread scheduler until the time interval has elapsed. 不是普通的应用程序通常有用的。 is not generally useful for ordinary applications. 在大多数情况下，应使用.NET Framework 中; 提供的同步类例如，调用或包装语句(`lock`在 C# 或`SyncLock`在 Visual Basic 中)。In most cases, you should use the synchronization classes provided by the .NET Framework; for example, call or a statement that wraps (`lock` in C# or `SyncLock` in Visual Basic). > [!CAUTION] > 在的罕见情况下，它将非常有利，若要避免的上下文切换，例如，当已知状态更改即将发生时，请调用在循环中的方法。In the rare case where it is advantageous to avoid a context switch, such as when you know that a state change is imminent, make a call to the method in your loop. 代码执行旨在防止具有多个处理器的计算机可能会发生的问题。The code executes is designed to prevent problems that can occur on computers with multiple processors. 例如，在具有多个使用超线程技术的 Intel 处理器的计算机上可防止在某些情况下的处理器资源不足。For example, on computers with multiple Intel processors employing Hyper-Threading technology, prevents processor starvation in certain situations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一旦线程处于状态时，操作系统可以计划它的执行。Once a thread is in the state, the operating system can schedule it for execution. 线程开始执行时所表示的方法的第一行执行或委托提供给线程构造函数。The thread begins executing at the first line of the method represented by the or delegate supplied to the thread constructor. 请注意，调用不会阻止调用线程。Note that the call to does not block the calling thread. 一旦线程终止，它无法重启通过再次调用`Start`。Once the thread terminates, it cannot be restarted with another call to `Start`. 此重载和委托进行轻松地将数据传递给一个线程的过程，但技术不是类型安全，因为可以将任何对象传递给此重载。This overload and the delegate make it easy to pass data to a thread procedure, but the technique is not type safe because any object can be passed to this overload. 若要将数据传递给一个线程的过程更可靠方法是放入一个辅助对象的线程的过程和数据字段。A more robust way to pass data to a thread procedure is to put both the thread procedure and the data fields into a worker object. 有关详细信息，请参阅[创建线程并在启动时传递数据](~/docs/standard/threading/creating-threads-and-passing-data-at-start-time.md)。For more information, see [Creating Threads and Passing Data at Start Time](~/docs/standard/threading/creating-threads-and-passing-data-at-start-time.md). ## Examples 下面的示例创建委托，它具有一个静态方法和实例方法。The following example creates a delegate with a static method and an instance method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 和进行同步的特殊情况。 and are for special cases of synchronization. 在正常情况下，C#`lock`语句，Visual Basic`SyncLock`语句，和类提供更轻松的替代项。Under normal circumstances, the C# `lock` statement, the Visual Basic `SyncLock` statement, and the class provide easier alternatives. 在多处理器系统中，获得由任何处理器写入的内存位置的最新值。On a multiprocessor system, obtains the very latest value written to a memory location by any processor. 这可能需要刷新处理器缓存。This might require flushing processor caches. 即使在单处理器系统中，和确保值为读取或写入到内存，并不缓存 （例如，在处理器寄存器）。Even on a uniprocessor system, and ensure that a value is read or written to memory, and not cached (for example, in a processor register). 因此，你可以使用它们可以由另一个线程或硬件更新的字段对访问进行同步。Thus, you can use them to synchronize access to a field that can be updated by another thread, or by hardware. 调用此方法只影响单个内存访问。Calling this method affects only a single memory access. 若要提供字段的有效同步，对字段的所有访问必须都使用或。To provide effective synchronization for a field, all access to the field must use or . > [!NOTE] > 在 C# 中，使用`volatile`字段上的修饰符可保证对该字段的所有访问都使用或。In C#, using the `volatile` modifier on a field guarantees that all access to that field uses or .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 和进行同步的特殊情况。 and are for special cases of synchronization. 在正常情况下，C#`lock`语句，Visual Basic`SyncLock`语句，和类提供更轻松的替代项。Under normal circumstances, the C# `lock` statement, the Visual Basic `SyncLock` statement, and the class provide easier alternatives. 在多处理器系统中，获得由任何处理器写入的内存位置的最新值。On a multiprocessor system, obtains the very latest value written to a memory location by any processor. 这可能需要刷新处理器缓存。This might require flushing processor caches. 即使在单处理器系统中，和确保值为读取或写入到内存，并不缓存 （例如，在处理器寄存器）。Even on a uniprocessor system, and ensure that a value is read or written to memory, and not cached (for example, in a processor register). 因此，你可以使用它们可以由另一个线程或硬件更新的字段对访问进行同步。Thus, you can use them to synchronize access to a field that can be updated by another thread, or by hardware. 调用此方法只影响单个内存访问。Calling this method affects only a single memory access. 若要提供字段的有效同步，对字段的所有访问必须都使用或。To provide effective synchronization for a field, all access to the field must use or . > [!NOTE] > 在 C# 中，使用`volatile`字段上的修饰符可保证对该字段的所有访问都使用或。In C#, using the `volatile` modifier on a field guarantees that all access to that field uses or .

span.span: Writes a value to a field immediately, so that the value is visible to all processors in the computer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 和进行同步的特殊情况。 and are for special cases of synchronization. 在正常情况下，C#`lock`语句，Visual Basic`SyncLock`语句，和类提供更轻松的替代项。Under normal circumstances, the C# `lock` statement, the Visual Basic `SyncLock` statement, and the class provide easier alternatives. 在多处理器系统中，可确保写入内存位置的值是立即可见的所有处理器。On a multiprocessor system, ensures that a value written to a memory location is immediately visible to all processors. 这可能需要刷新处理器缓存。This might require flushing processor caches. 即使在单处理器系统中，和确保值为读取或写入到内存，并不缓存 （例如，在处理器寄存器）。Even on a uniprocessor system, and ensure that a value is read or written to memory, and not cached (for example, in a processor register). 因此，你可以使用它们可以由另一个线程或硬件更新的字段对访问进行同步。Thus, you can use them to synchronize access to a field that can be updated by another thread, or by hardware. 调用此方法只影响单个内存访问。Calling this method affects only a single memory access. 若要提供字段的有效同步，对字段的所有访问必须都使用或。To provide effective synchronization for a field, all access to the field must use or . > [!NOTE] > 在 C# 中，使用`volatile`字段上的修饰符可保证对该字段的所有访问都使用或。In C#, using the `volatile` modifier on a field guarantees that all access to that field uses or .

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool Yield ();
.method public static hidebysig bool Yield() cil managed
Public Shared Function Yield () As Boolean
public: static bool Yield();

summary.span: 导致调用线程执行准备好在当前处理器上运行的另一个线程。

span.span: Causes the calling thread to yield execution to another thread that is ready to run on the current processor.

summary.span: 由操作系统选择要执行的线程。

span.span: The operating system selects the thread to yield to.

returns.span: 如果操作系统转而执行另一个线程，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the operating system switched execution to another thread; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果此方法成功，生成了线程的当前时间片的其余部分。If this method succeeds, the rest of the thread's current time slice is yielded. 操作系统调度调用线程的另一个时间段，根据其优先级和可用于运行其他线程的状态。The operating system schedules the calling thread for another time slice, according to its priority and the status of other threads that are available to run. 生成操作仅限于执行调用线程的处理器。Yielding is limited to the processor that is executing the calling thread. 操作系统将不执行切换到另一个处理器，即使该处理器处于空闲状态或正在运行较低优先级的线程。The operating system will not switch execution to another processor, even if that processor is idle or is running a thread of lower priority. 如果没有其他线程准备好在当前处理器上执行，操作系统不会生成执行，并且此方法返回`false`。If there are no other threads that are ready to execute on the current processor, the operating system does not yield execution, and this method returns `false`. 此方法相当于使用平台调用来调用本机 Win32`SwitchToThread`函数。This method is equivalent to using platform invoke to call the native Win32 `SwitchToThread` function. 应调用方法而不是使用平台调用，因为平台调用会跳过任何自定义的线程处理行为的主机已请求。You should call the method instead of using platform invoke, because platform invoke bypasses any custom threading behavior the host has requested.
